posts.name: Galã da Programação
posts.cooked:
Me and my team are trying for the first time to use our roboRIO 2.0 and FRC roboRIO Imaging Tool - Version 23.0 . We’re following the current steps of the WPILib - Imaging your roboRIO 2 . However, when we tried to Select Image directly with the Imaging Tool, the program doesn’t recognize the FRC_roboRIO2_2023_v3.1 as you can see below: Also, when we tried to do it manually, clicking on the “SD Folder” and selecting the file by ourselves, Windows says that this fille is corrupted.

PS: Besides we know that roboRIO 2.0 can’t Reformat by USB Cable, that was the only way to make our roboRIO-0000-FRC appears in roboRIo Targets .

BTW, we already tried to Writing the image with balenaEtcher and the file FRC_roboRIO2_2023_v3.1 flashed in our SD with no problems as we know.

So, we’re feeling stuck due to this problems and also, what to do with the roboRIO next, any help as possible would be really thankul!

link_counts.title: Imaging your roboRIO 2 — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: It’s not possible to format the roboRIO 2.0 with the imaging tool, but as you already wrote the image and the Rio appears to have started up, just with no team number, you should be able to set the team number by selecting the “Edit Startup Settings” radio button (and putting your team number into the team number box).

posts.name: Galã da Programação
posts.cooked: Ok. So let me see if I understood, if it’s impossible to format the roboRIO 2.0 with the imaging tool, the program is completly useless after all? As I already flashed the file in the SD card with balenaEtcher. Right?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: No.  You still need to use the program to set the team number (the image is a generic image and so it needs the team number set to be usable).

posts.name: Galã da Programação
posts.cooked: Cool. But, to set the team number I must connect the roboRIO 2.0 with the imaging tool, should it be by USB Cable, SD or other way I don’t know? As far as I discovered, roboRIO 2.0 don’t support connection via cable, or this information just applies for format the image?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: You can set the team number by connecting either through USB or Ethernet; I’ve generally found USB to be more reliable.

posts.name: Galã da Programação
posts.cooked: Ok. I ain’t with the equipments right now to test everthing you told me, that’s why can’t give you a feedback. But, tomorrow I’ll get the hands dirty. Thanks for all your help until far!

posts.name: Galã da Programação
posts.cooked: Thanks for all your help @Peter_Johnson . Everything is working perfectly now.
